com.immortallabs.cardboard
Class CardBoardApp

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      com.immortallabs.cardboard.CardBoardApp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class CardBoardApp
extends javax.swing.JApplet

The CardBoardApp class starts the logic and CardBoard UI required to run the CardBoard Game.

Version:
2.1, March 08th, 2009
Author:
Lamont Samuels, John Dalbey, ImmortalLabs CSC 309 W'09, Formerly Michael Brooks in v1.4, Formerly Justin Appler in v1.1, Formerly Thomas Dvornik in v1.0, Formerly RustyNail CSC308 F08
See Also:
Serialized Form
Version History:
- 03/08/09 2.1 Corrected checkstyle errors. - 03/07/09 2.0 Updated CardBoardApp to run the game in text,graphical as an applet and graphical from a jar. - 01/30/09 1.4 Fixed checkstyle errors.(Ticket 65)
- 01/26/09 1.3 Fixed initial bugs.
- 01/17/08 1.2 Added pseudocode and code.
- 12/03/08 1.1 Took class from Tom, Added Pseudocode, Conformed JavaDocs
- 12/01/08 1.0 Initial Class Skeleton

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Starts the CardBoard Game. While the method accepts arguments per the Java Specification, no arguments are used.

Parameters:
args - Arguments sent to CardBoardApp when the game is started.
